conclusion: To determine whether the distance fallen during the 0 to 10 seconds interval is greater than 100 meters or less than 100 meters, we need to analyze the velocity-time graph.
The graph shows the velocity (v) as a function of time (t).
The area under the velocity-time graph gives the distance traveled.
For the time interval from 0 to 10 seconds, the graph is a curve that starts at the origin and increases to a maximum velocity of 20 m/s at t = 10 seconds.

premise: The area under the velocity-time graph gives the distance traveled. The graph from 0 to 10 seconds is a curve that starts at the origin and increases to a maximum velocity of 20 m/s.
conclusion: The area under the curve from 0 to 10 seconds can be approximated by the area of a triangle.

premise: The area under the curve from 0 to 10 seconds can be approximated by the area of a triangle.
conclusion: The area of the triangle is given by: Area = (1/2) × base × height.

premise: The area of the triangle is given by: Area = (1/2) × base × height. The base is the time interval (10 seconds), and the height is the maximum velocity (20 m/s).
conclusion: The area of the triangle is (1/2) × 10 × 20 = 100 meters.

premise: The area of the triangle is (1/2) × 10 × 20 = 100 meters.
conclusion: The area under the curve from 0 to 10 seconds is exactly 100 meters.
